page.title: 04MUNDON FARMING - PROBLEMS
page.content: Some animals are a problem to farmers.The worst problem is the Brent geese,which come in huge flocks and destroy his crops by treading on them and eating them.His licence only allows him to shoot ten geese per year and so he relies on a small cannon, bangers and fluttering things like kites and balloons to frighten them. Unfortunately geese get used to these methods. Foxes are also a problem because they kill chickens,ducks and even small lambs.Shooting is the quick way of abolishing them as hunting is not very effective and poison or traps are too dangerous. Moles destroy the roots of the plants and sparrows eat animal feed and newly sown seed. By Rebecca Morley,Helen Carlile, Sarah Ball & Stephanie Varney.
